exceptions.exn: In environment K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V Unable to unify "is_linear (fun _ : ?U => zero) /\\ (forall x : ?U, is_filter_lim ?F x -> Equiv.is_domin ?F (fun y : ?U => minus y x) (fun y : ?U => minus (minus ((fun _ : ?U => ?M2363) y) ((fun _ : ?U => ?M2363) x)) ((fun _ : ?U => zero) (minus y x))))" with "forall P : V -> Prop, locally (a 0%nat) P -> filtermap (sum_n (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n zero k) (a k))) eventually P".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K
a: nat -> V

Goal:
is_pseries a zero (a 0%nat)

Premises:
is_pseries = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) (x : K) (l : V) => is_series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k)) l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> K -> V -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _ _]
zero = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.zero G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
PSeries_correct : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), ex_pseries a x -> is_pseries a x (PSeries a x)
is_pseries_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (x l : R), is_pseries a x l -> PSeries a x = l
is_pseries_Reals : forall (a : nat -> R) (x l : R), is_pseries a x l < -> Pser a x l
is_pseries_R : forall (a : nat -> R) (x l : R), is_pseries a x l < -> is_series (fun n : nat => a n * x ^ n) l
is_pseries_ext : forall (a0 b : nat -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), (forall n : nat, a0 n = b n) -> is_pseries a0 x l -> is_pseries b x l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
linear_zero : forall l : ?U -> ?V, is_linear l -> l zero = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
sum_n_m = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat) => Iter.iter_nat plus zero a n m : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
is_series_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> Series a = l
PSeries_eq : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), PSeries a x = Series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k))
scal_zero_r : forall x : ?K, scal x zero = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- ModuleSpace ?K]
scal_zero_l : forall u : ?V, scal zero u = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- ModuleSpace ?K]
sum_n_Reals : forall (a : nat -> R_AbelianGroup) (N : nat), sum_n a N = sum_f_R0 a N
mult_zero_r : forall x : ?K, mult x zero = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Ring]
mult_zero_l : forall x : ?K, mult zero x = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Ring]
prod_norm_eq_zero : forall x : ?U * ?V, prod_norm x = 0 -> x = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
norm_eq_zero : forall x : ?V, norm x = 0 -> x = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_pseries = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) (x : K) => ex_series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k)) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
filterdiff_iter_plus_fct : forall (l : list ?I) (f df : ?I -> ?U -> ?V), ?U -> (forall j : ?I, List.In j l -> filterdiff (f j) ?F (df j)) -> filterdiff (fun y : ?U => Iter.iter plus zero l (fun j : ?I => f j y)) ?F (fun x0 : ?U => Iter.iter plus zero l (fun j : ?I => df j x0)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?I : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Type] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?U -> Prop) ->...-> V |- Filter ?F]
PSeries = fun (a : nat -> R) (x : R) => Series (fun k : nat => a k * x ^ k) : (nat -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
is_derive_const : forall (a0 : ?V) (x : ?K), is_derive (fun _ : ?K => a0) x zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
abs_eq_zero : forall x : ?K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing]
sum_n_m_zero : forall (a0 : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (m < n)%nat -> sum_n_m a0 n m = zero where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
Mone_seq_not_diag : forall i j : nat, i <> j -> Mone_seq i j = zero where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Ring]
minus_eq_zero : forall x : ?G, minus x x = zero where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
plus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, plus x zero = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
minus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, minus x zero = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
plus_zero_l : forall x : ?G, plus zero x = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
plus_opp_r : forall x : ?G, plus x (opp x) = zero where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
plus_opp_l : forall x : ?G, plus (opp x) x = zero where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope]
sum_n_m_const_zero : forall n m : nat, sum_n_m (fun _ : nat => zero) n m = zero where ?G : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbelianGroup]
filterdiff_ext_lin : forall f l1 l2 : ?U -> ?V, filterdiff f ?F l1 -> (forall y : ?U, l1 y = l2 y) -> filterdiff f ?F l2 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Filter ?F]
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P Datatypes.nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
is_series = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) (l : V) => filterlim (sum_n a) eventually (locally l) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> V -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
filterdiff_const : forall a0 : ?V, filterdiff (fun _ : ?U => a0) ?F (fun _ : ?U => zero) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_norm_zero : forall f : ?U -> ?V, filterlim (fun x : ?U => norm (f x)) ?F (locally 0) -> filterlim f ?F (locally zero) where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Type] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Filter ?F]
filterdiff_plus_fct : forall f g lf lg : ?U -> ?V, filterdiff f ?F lf -> filterdiff g ?F lg -> filterdiff (fun u : ?U => plus (f u) (g u)) ?F (fun u : ?U => plus (lf u) (lg u)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Filter ?F]
Iter.iter_nat = fun (T : Type) (op : T -> T -> T) (x0 : T) (a : nat -> T) (n m : nat) => Iter.iter op x0 (seq.iota n (S m - n)) a : forall T : Type, (T -> T -> T) -> T -> (nat -> T) -> nat -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
filterlim_locally_ball_norm : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (y : ?U), filterlim f ?F (locally y) < -> (forall eps : posreal, ?F (fun x : ?T => ball_norm y eps (f x))) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Type] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Filter ?F]
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Type] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K a : nat -> V |- Filter ?F]
